alert.note: Alert for Greater Lake Tahoe Area (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 22 at 3:19AM PST until January 23 at 1:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM PST TUESDAY FOR THE LAKE TAHOE BASIN ABOVE 6500 FEET... * WHAT...Snow with additional accumulations of 8 to 14 inches above 7000 feet, and 3 to 8 inches between 6500 and 7000 feet. Below 6500 feet, accumulations of 1 to 3 inches are possible. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph with gusts to 60 mph along Sierra ridges in the morning. * WHERE...Greater Lake Tahoe Area. * WHEN...Until 1 AM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult at times. The hazardous conditions could impact daily commutes through this evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The main period of snow is expected through this afternoon. This evening, lighter snow will continue mainly near the Sierra crest. Road conditions will vary from wet to slushy and snow covered across the Tahoe region through tonight. Check with Caltrans or NDOT for the latest road conditions.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
